text: John Macarthur (1766 â€“ 11 April 1834Macarthur, John (1767 - 1834) Australian Dictionary of Biography) was a soldier, business man, politician and the man who started the Australian wool industry. His farmhouse, called Elizabeth Farm after his wife, is still standing in Parramatta, New South Wales, where it is open to the public as a historic house. ==References== Category:1766 births Category:1834 deaths
title: John Macarthur (wool pioneer)
